intro: Eschweilera lutea, commonly known as the yellow eschweilera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myristicaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom during the wet season. Eschweilera lutea is often found in lowland rainforests and is adapted to high humidity and warm temperatures. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
